trans-unit.source: Any QObject-derived C++ class can be registered as the definition of a QML object type. Once a class is registered with the QML type system, the class can be declared and instantiated like any other object type from QML code. Once created, a class instance can be manipulated from QML; as Exposing Attributes of C++ Types to QML explains, the properties, methods and signals of any QObject-derived class are accessible from QML code.

Any QObject-derived C++ class can be registered as the definition of a QML object type. Once a class is registered with the QML type system, the class can be declared and instantiated like any other object type from QML code. Once created, a class instance can be manipulated from QML; as Exposing Attributes of C++ Types to QML explains, the properties, methods and signals of any QObject-derived class are accessible from QML code.
trans-unit.target: Cualquier clase de C ++ derivada de QObject puede registrarse como la definición de un tipo de objeto QML . Una vez que una clase se registra con el sistema de tipos QML, la clase puede declararse y instanciarse como cualquier otro tipo de objeto del código QML. Una vez creada, una instancia de clase se puede manipular desde QML; como explica Exposing Attributes of C ++ Types to QML , las propiedades, métodos y señales de cualquier clase derivada de QObject son accesibles desde el código QML.

trans-unit.source: Applications must adapt to situations where users have multiple displays with varying resolutions For example, a user might use a 4K monitor for the document window of an image editor but a low resolution monitor for the tool box.

Applications using UI designs with fixed coordinates look small The combination of specifying font size in points and other sizes in pixels is particularly problematic because points are independent from the monitor's resolution. For example, suppose we have a frame of 40x20 pixels around the text "hello". If we use a 12pt font, it would look correct on low resolution monitors. But, on high DPI monitors, the frame would be too small, resulting in the text being clipped.

trans-unit.source: Clean state: Used to signal when the document enters and leaves a state that has been saved to disk. This is typically used to disable or enable the save actions, and to update the document's title bar.
trans-unit.target: Estado limpio: se utiliza para señalar cuando el documento entra y sale de un estado que se ha guardado en el disco. Por lo general, se usa para deshabilitar o habilitar las acciones de guardado y para actualizar la barra de título del documento.

trans-unit.target: Color

trans-unit.source: Command compression: Used to compress sequences of commands into a single command. For example: In a text editor, the commands that insert individual characters into the document can be compressed into a single command that inserts whole sections of text. These bigger changes are more convenient for the user to undo and redo.
trans-unit.target: Compresión de comandos: se utiliza para comprimir secuencias de comandos en un solo comando. Por ejemplo: en un editor de texto, los comandos que insertan caracteres individuales en el documento se pueden comprimir en un solo comando que inserta secciones completas de texto. Estos cambios más importantes son más convenientes para que el usuario deshaga y rehaga.

trans-unit.source: Command macros: A sequence of commands, all of which are undone or redone in one step. These simplify the task of writing an application, since a set of simpler commands can be composed into more complex commands. For example, a command that moves a set of selected objects in a document can be created by combining a set of commands, each of which moves a single object.
trans-unit.target: Macros de comando: una secuencia de comandos, todos los cuales se deshacen o rehacen en un solo paso. Estos simplifican la tarea de escribir una aplicación, ya que un conjunto de comandos más simples se pueden componer en comandos más complejos. Por ejemplo, un comando que mueve un conjunto de objetos seleccionados en un documento se puede crear combinando un conjunto de comandos, cada uno de los cuales mueve un solo objeto.

trans-unit.source: Conformance to standards: Conformance to all applicable XML and XQuery standards ensures that Qt XML Patterns can always process XML documents generated by other conformant applications, and that XML documents created with Qt XML Patterns can be processed by other conformant applications.

Conformance to standards: Conformance to all applicable XML and XQuery standards ensures that Qt XML Patterns can always process XML documents generated by other conformant applications, and that XML documents created with Qt XML Patterns can be processed by other conformant applications.
trans-unit.target: Cumplimiento de los estándares : el cumplimiento de todos los estándares XML y XQuery aplicables garantiza que Qt XML Patterns siempre pueda procesar documentos XML generados por otras aplicaciones compatibles, y que los documentos XML creados con Qt XML Patterns puedan ser procesados por otras aplicaciones compatibles.

trans-unit.source: Cons: Can be expensive to use. Does not help with texture or reflection issues.
Cons: Can severely degrade performance when your scene is already limited by the fill-rate of the graphics system, which is often the case.
Cons: Cannot be used if the silhouette of the object will ever change. Multiple overlapping models that employ transparency consume fill rate performance, which is often at a premium.

Cons: Does not help with texture or reflection issues. Increases video memory usage. Can be expensive to use on less powerful graphics hardware. When using View3D items with a renderMode other than Offscreen, MSAA can only be controlled on a per-window basis, it cannot be enabled or disabled separately for the individual View3D items.
Cons: Does not take effect if any visual changes are occurring. 8x PAA takes one eighth of a second to finish rendering (at 60fps), which may be noticeable.
Cons: Does not take effect if any visual changes are occurring. Expensive due to having to accumulate and blend. Increases video memory usage.
Cons: Fast-moving objects cause one-frame ghosting.
Cons: Requires using external tools to optimize your images. Uses 33% more graphics memory than the same image without mipmaps.
Cons: Usually more expensive than MSAA. Increases video memory usage. Only supported with View3D items with renderMode set to Offscreen as the technique implies rendering to a texture first.

trans-unit.source: Constant time: O(1). A function is said to run in constant time if it requires the same amount of time no matter how many items are present in the container. One example is QLinkedList::insert().
trans-unit.target: Tiempo constante: O (1). Se dice que una función se ejecuta en tiempo constante si requiere la misma cantidad de tiempo sin importar cuántos elementos estén presentes en el contenedor. Un ejemplo es QLinkedList :: insert ().

trans-unit.source: Constant time: O(1). A function is said to run in constant time if it requires the same amount of time no matter how many items are present in the container. One example is QList::push_back().

trans-unit.source: Delegate - dictates how the data should appear in the view. The delegate takes each data in the model and encapsulates it. The data is accessible through the delegate. The delegate can also write data back into editable models (e.g. in a TextField's onAccepted Handler).
trans-unit.target: Delegado : dicta cómo deben aparecer los datos en la vista. El delegado toma cada dato del modelo y lo encapsula. Los datos son accesibles a través del delegado. El delegado también puede volver a escribir datos en modelos editables (por ejemplo, en un controlador onAccepted de TextField ).

trans-unit.source: Delegate - dictates how the data should appear in the view. The delegate takes each data in the model and encapsulates it. The data is accessible through the delegate. The delegate can also write data back into editable models (e.g. in a TextField's onAccepted Handler).

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop support and MIME type handling: Models inherit functions that control the way that internal and external drag and drop operations are performed. These functions allow items of data to be described in terms of MIME types that other components and applications can understand.

Estas funciones permiten que los elementos de datos se describan en términos de tipos MIME que otros componentes y aplicaciones pueden comprender.

trans-unit.source: Extended selections: Widgets that often require many adjacent items to be selected, such as those found in spreadsheets, require the ExtendedSelection mode. In this mode, continuous ranges of items in the widget can be selected with both the mouse and the keyboard. Complex selections, involving many items that are not adjacent to other selected items in the widget, can also be created if modifier keys are used.
trans-unit.target: Selecciones extendidas: los widgets que a menudo requieren que se seleccionen muchos elementos adyacentes, como los que se encuentran en hojas de cálculo, requieren el modo ExtendedSelection . En este modo, los rangos continuos de elementos en el widget se pueden seleccionar tanto con el mouse como con el teclado. También se pueden crear selecciones complejas, que involucran muchos elementos que no son adyacentes a otros elementos seleccionados en el widget, si se utilizan teclas modificadoras.

trans-unit.source: For Servers The server, or compositor, connects to the display and shows the contents of each client on the screen. The compositor handles input and sends input events to the corresponding client. In turn, each client connects to the compositor and sends the content of its windows. It's up to the compositor to decide:
trans-unit.target: Para servidores El servidor, o compositor, se conecta a la pantalla y muestra el contenido de cada cliente en la pantalla. El compositor maneja la entrada y envía eventos de entrada al cliente correspondiente. A su vez, cada cliente se conecta al compositor y envía el contenido de sus ventanas. Depende del compositor decidir:

trans-unit.source: Handling Pivot Points DCC (Digital Content Creation) tools all handle pivot points differently. In Qt Quick 3D, there is only one pivot per object and it is used as the origin for position, scale, and rotation operations. In your DCC tool, feel free to adjust the position of a 3D model's pivot as needed. However, extreme edits to pivots in 3D modeling tools can cause problems upon import, especially if animated. This difference is often manifested as a difference in the position or orientation of an object. As an artist, you can prevent these kinds of problems by only making simple edits to your pivot points. Keep your pivot points to the default (world) alignment, don't scale them, and make sure that if you have multiple pivots (Maya) that they are all at the same location in space.

Handling Pivot Points Each DCC (Digital Content Creation) tool handles pivot points differently. In Qt Quick 3D, there is only one pivot per object and it is used as the origin for position, scale, and rotation operations. In your DCC tool, feel free to adjust the position of a 3D model's pivot as needed. However, extreme edits to pivots in 3D modeling tools can cause problems upon import, especially if animated. This difference is often manifested as a difference in the position or orientation of an object. As an artist, you can prevent these kinds of problems by only making simple edits to your pivot points. Keep your pivot points to the default (world) alignment, don't scale them, and make sure that if you have multiple pivots (Maya) that they are all at the same location in space.

trans-unit.source: Important Note: There are some minor differences between the semantics of such sequence Array types and default JavaScript Array types which result from the use of a C++ storage type in the implementation. In particular, deleting an element from an Array will result in a default-constructed value replacing that element, rather than an Undefined value. Similarly, setting the length property of the Array to a value larger than its current value will result in the Array being padded out to the specified length with default-constructed elements rather than Undefined elements. Finally, the Qt container classes support signed (rather than unsigned) integer indexes; thus, attempting to access any index greater than INT_MAX will fail.
trans-unit.target: Nota importante: existen algunas diferencias menores entre la semántica de tales tipos de matriz de secuencia y los tipos de matriz de JavaScript predeterminados que resultan del uso de un tipo de almacenamiento C ++ en la implementación. En particular, eliminar un elemento de una matriz dará como resultado un valor construido por defecto que reemplaza ese elemento, en lugar de un valor indefinido. De manera similar, establecer la propiedad de longitud de la matriz en un valor mayor que su valor actual dará como resultado que la matriz se rellene a la longitud especificada con elementos construidos por defecto en lugar de elementos no definidos. Finalmente, las clases de contenedor Qt admiten índices enteros firmados (en lugar de sin firmar); por lo tanto, el intento de acceder a cualquier índice mayor que INT_MAX fallará.

Important: When building static QML applications, QML files are scanned to detect import dependencies. That way, all necessary plugins and resources are resolved at compile time. However, only explicit import statements are considered (those found at the top of a QML file), and not import statements enclosed within string literals. To support static builds, you therefore need to ensure that QML files using Qt.createQmlObject(), explicitly contain all necessary imports at the top of the file in addition to inside the string literals.
trans-unit.target: Importante: al crear aplicaciones QML estáticas, los archivos QML se escanean para detectar dependencias de importación. De esa manera, todos los complementos y recursos necesarios se resuelven en tiempo de compilación. Sin embargo, solo se consideran las declaraciones de importación explícitas (las que se encuentran en la parte superior de un archivo QML), y no las declaraciones de importación incluidas dentro de cadenas literales. Para admitir compilaciones estáticas, debe asegurarse de que los archivos QML que usan Qt.createQmlObject () contengan explícitamente todas las importaciones necesarias en la parte superior del archivo, además de dentro de los literales de cadena.

trans-unit.source: Maps and Navigation provides QtQuick user interface types for displaying geographic information on a map, as well as allowing user interaction with map overlay objects and the display itself. It also contains utilities for geocoding (finding a geographic coordinate from a street address) and navigation (including driving and walking directions).
trans-unit.target: Mapas y navegación proporciona tipos de interfaz de usuario QtQuick para mostrar información geográfica en un mapa, además de permitir la interacción del usuario con objetos superpuestos de mapas y la pantalla en sí. También contiene utilidades para la codificación geográfica (encontrar una coordenada geográfica a partir de la dirección de una calle) y la navegación (incluidas las indicaciones para conducir y caminar).

trans-unit.source: Maps and Navigation provides QtQuick user interface types for displaying geographic information on a map, as well as allowing user interaction with map overlay objects and the display itself. It also contains utilities for geocoding (finding a geographic coordinate from a street address) and navigation (including driving and walking directions).

trans-unit.source: Note: QAbstractVideoFilter is not always the best choice. To apply effects or transformations using OpenGL shaders to the image shown on screen, the standard Qt Quick approach of using ShaderEffect items in combination with VideoOutput should be used. VideoFilter is not a replacement for this. It is rather targeted for performing computations (that do not necessarily change the image shown on screen) and computer vision algorithms provided by external frameworks.
trans-unit.target: Nota: QAbstractVideoFilter no siempre es la mejor opción. Para aplicar efectos o transformaciones usando sombreadores OpenGL a la imagen que se muestra en la pantalla, se debe usar el enfoque estándar Qt Quick de usar elementos ShaderEffect en combinación con VideoOutput . VideoFilter no reemplaza esto. Más bien está dirigido a realizar cálculos (que no necesariamente cambian la imagen que se muestra en la pantalla) y algoritmos de visión por computadora proporcionados por marcos externos.

trans-unit.source: Note: QQuickWidget is an alternative to using QQuickView and QWidget::createWindowContainer(). The restrictions on stacking order do not apply, making QQuickWidget the more flexible alternative, behaving more like an ordinary widget. This comes at the expense of performance. Unlike QQuickWindow and QQuickView, QQuickWidget involves rendering into OpenGL framebuffer objects. This will naturally carry a minor performance hit.
trans-unit.target: Nota: QQuickWidget es una alternativa al uso de QQuickView y QWidget :: createWindowContainer (). Las restricciones sobre el orden de apilamiento no se aplican, por lo que QQuickWidget es la alternativa más flexible y se comporta más como un widget ordinario. Esto se produce a expensas del rendimiento. A diferencia de QQuickWindow y QQuickView , QQuickWidget implica la renderización en objetos framebuffer OpenGL. Esto, naturalmente, tendrá un impacto menor en el rendimiento.

trans-unit.source: Note: QQuickWidget offers less fine-grained control over its internal OpenGL context than QOpenGLWidget, and there are subtle differences, most notably that disabling the persistent scene graph will lead to destroying the context on a window change regardless of the presence of QCoreApplication::AA_ShareOpenGLContexts.
trans-unit.target: Nota: QQuickWidget ofrece un control menos detallado sobre su contexto OpenGL interno que QOpenGLWidget , y existen diferencias sutiles, más notablemente que deshabilitar el gráfico de escena persistente conducirá a destruir el contexto en un cambio de ventana independientemente de la presencia de QCoreApplication :: AA_ShareOpenGLContexts .

Note: QSGRenderNode can perform significantly better than texture-based approaches (such as, QQuickFramebufferObject), especially on systems where the fragment processing power is limited. This is because it avoids rendering to a texture and then drawing a textured quad. Rather, QSGRenderNode allows recording draw calls in line with the scenegraph's other commands, avoiding an additional render target and the potentially expensive texturing and blending.

Note: QSGRenderNode is provided as a means to implement custom 2D or 2.5D Qt Quick items. It is not intended for integrating true 3D content into the Qt Quick scene. That use case is better supported by QQuickFramebufferObject, QQuickWindow::beforeRendering(), or the equivalents of those for APIs other than OpenGL.
trans-unit.target: Nota: QSGRenderNode se proporciona como un medio para implementar elementos rápidos personalizados en 2D o 2.5D Qt. No está diseñado para integrar contenido 3D real en la escena Qt Quick. Ese caso de uso es mejor compatible con QQuickFramebufferObject , QQuickWindow :: beforeRendering () o los equivalentes de los de API distintas de OpenGL.

trans-unit.source: Note: RenderTargetState is no longer supported with APIs like Vulkan. This is by nature. render() is invoked while the Qt Quick scenegraph's main command buffer is recording a renderpass, so there is no possibility of changing the target and starting another renderpass (on that command buffer at least). Therefore returning a value with RenderTargetState set is not sensible.

trans-unit.source: Note: QFuture in general allows sharing the results between different QFuture objects (and potentially between different threads). takeResult() was introduced to make QFuture also work with move-only types (like std::unique_ptr), so it assumes that only one thread can move the results out of the future, and do it only once. Also note that taking the list of all results is not supported at the moment. However you can still iterate through the list of move-only results by using STL-style iterators or read-only Java-style iterators.
Note: Q_LIKELY() tells the compiler that the expression is likely, but not the only possibility. Q_ASSUME tells the compiler that it is the only possibility.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Q_LIKELY () le dice al compilador que la expresión es probable, pero no la única posibilidad. Q_ASSUME le dice al compilador que es la única posibilidad.

Note: *.* is not a portable filter, because the historical assumption that the file extension determines the file type is not consistent on every operating system. It is possible to have a file with no dot in its name (for example, Makefile). In a native Windows file dialog, *.* will match such files, while in other types of file dialogs it may not. So it is better to use * if you mean to select any file.
trans-unit.target: Nota: *. * No es un filtro portátil, porque la suposición histórica de que la extensión del archivo determina el tipo de archivo no es consistente en todos los sistemas operativos. Es posible tener un archivo sin puntos en su nombre (por ejemplo, Makefile ). En un cuadro de diálogo de archivo nativo de Windows, *. * Coincidirá con dichos archivos, mientras que en otros tipos de cuadros de diálogo de archivo puede que no. Por lo tanto, es mejor usar * si desea seleccionar cualquier archivo.

trans-unit.source: Note: A Material may use multiple textures to give the desired interaction with light in the 3D scene. See the principled material example for a demonstration of a material with multiple texture maps.

trans-unit.source: Note: A newly added series is not attached to any axes by default, not even those that might have been created for the chart using createDefaultAxes() before the series was added to the chart. If no axes are attached to the newly added series before the chart is shown, the series will get drawn as if it had axes with ranges that exactly fit the series to the plot area of the chart. This can be confusing if the same chart also displays other series that have properly attached axes, so always make sure you either call createDefaultAxes() after a series has been added or explicitly attach axes for the series.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Una serie recién agregada no se adjunta a ningún eje de forma predeterminada, ni siquiera a aquellos que podrían haber sido creados para el gráfico usando createDefaultAxes () antes de que la serie se agregara al gráfico. Si no se adjuntan ejes a la serie recién agregada antes de que se muestre el gráfico, la serie se dibujará como si tuviera ejes con rangos que se ajustan exactamente a la serie en el área de trazado del gráfico. Esto puede resultar confuso si el mismo gráfico también muestra otras series que tienen ejes adjuntos correctamente, así que siempre asegúrese de llamar a createDefaultAxes () después de que se haya agregado una serie o adjunte explícitamente ejes para la serie.

Note: A state machine needs a QEventLoop to work correctly. The event loop is used to implement the delay attribute for events and to schedule the processing of a state machine when events are received from nested (or parent) state machines. A QML application or a widget application will always have an event loop running, so nothing extra is needed. For other applications, QApplication::run will have to be called to start the event loop processing.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Una máquina de estado necesita un QEventLoop para funcionar correctamente. El bucle de eventos se utiliza para implementar el atributo de delay de los eventos y para programar el procesamiento de una máquina de estado cuando se reciben eventos de máquinas de estado anidadas (o principales). Una aplicación QML o una aplicación de widget siempre tendrá un bucle de eventos en ejecución, por lo que no se necesita nada adicional. Para otras aplicaciones, será necesario llamar a QApplication::run para iniciar el procesamiento del bucle de eventos.

trans-unit.source: Note: A state machine will not run without a running event loop, such as the main application event loop started with QCoreApplication::exec() or QApplication::exec().
trans-unit.target: Nota: Una máquina de estado no se ejecutará sin un bucle de eventos en ejecución, como el bucle de eventos de la aplicación principal iniciado con QCoreApplication :: exec () o QApplication :: exec () .

Note: All other platforms handle this flag transparently and therefore applications can ignore it entirely. On Linux, the address type flag is not directly exposed by BlueZ although some use cases do require this information. The only way to detect the flag is via the Linux kernel's Bluetooth Management API (kernel version 3.4+ required). This API requires CAP_NET_ADMIN capabilities though. If the local QtBluetooth process has this capability set QtBluetooth will use the API. This assumes that QBluetoothDeviceDiscoveryAgent was used prior to calling QLowEnergyController::connectToDevice().
trans-unit.target: Nota: Todas las demás plataformas manejan este indicador de forma transparente y, por lo tanto, las aplicaciones pueden ignorarlo por completo. En Linux, BlueZ no expone directamente el indicador de tipo de dirección, aunque algunos casos de uso sí requieren esta información. La única forma de detectar la bandera es a través de la API de administración de Bluetooth del kernel de Linux (se requiere la versión 3.4+ del kernel). Sin embargo, esta API requiere capacidades CAP_NET_ADMIN. Si el proceso local de QtBluetooth tiene esta capacidad configurada, QtBluetooth utilizará la API. Esto supone que QBluetoothDeviceDiscoveryAgent se usó antes de llamar a QLowEnergyController :: connectToDevice ().

trans-unit.source: Note: All other platforms handle this flag transparently and therefore applications can ignore it entirely. On Linux, the address type flag is not directly exposed by BlueZ although some use cases do require this information. The only way to detect the flag is via the Linux kernel's Bluetooth Management API (kernel version 3.4+ required). This API requires CAP_NET_ADMIN capabilities though. If the local QtBluetooth process has this capability set QtBluetooth will use the API. This assumes that QBluetoothDeviceDiscoveryAgent was used prior to calling QLowEnergyController::connectToDevice().

trans-unit.source: Note: Avoid relying on this function when the update behavior is PartialUpdateBlit. This mode involves blitting the extra framebuffer used by paintGL() onto the default framebuffer after each invocation of paintGL(), thus overwriting all drawing generated in this function.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Evite confiar en esta función cuando el comportamiento de actualización sea PartialUpdateBlit . Este modo implica borrar el framebuffer adicional usado por paintGL () en el framebuffer predeterminado después de cada invocación de paintGL (), sobrescribiendo así todos los dibujos generados en esta función.

Note: Avoid using this function; instead, use open(). Unlike exec(), open() is asynchronous, and does not spin an additional event loop. This prevents a series of dangerous bugs from happening (e.g. deleting the dialog's parent while the dialog is open via exec()). When using open() you can connect to the finished() signal of QDialog to be notified when the dialog is closed.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Evite usar esta función; en su lugar, use open() . A diferencia de exec (), open () es asincrónico y no genera un ciclo de eventos adicional. Esto evita que ocurran una serie de errores peligrosos (por ejemplo, eliminar el padre del diálogo mientras el diálogo está abierto a través de exec ()). Al usar open (), puede conectarse a la señal de terminado () de QDialog para recibir una notificación cuando se cierre el diálogo.

trans-unit.source: Note: Be aware of the difference between the bytesWritten() signal and the encryptedBytesWritten() signal. For a QTcpSocket, bytesWritten() will get emitted as soon as data has been written to the TCP socket. Para un QTcpSocket , bytesWritten () se emitirán tan pronto como los datos se hayan escrito en el socket TCP. trans-unit.source: Note: Before Qt 5.14 it was possible to use this operator to access a character at an out-of-bounds position in the byte array, and then assign to such a position, causing the byte array to be automatically resized. These behaviors are deprecated, and will be changed in a future version of Qt.

Note: Before Qt 5.14 it was possible to use this operator to access a character at an out-of-bounds position in the string, and then assign to such a position, causing the string to be automatically resized. These behaviors are deprecated, and will be changed in a future version of Qt.

trans-unit.target: Nota: Llamar a esta función a pesar de que QLowEnergyCharacteristic :: properties () reporta una propiedad no legible siempre intenta leer el valor de la característica en el hardware. Si el hardware regresa con un error, se establece CharacteristicReadError .

trans-unit.source: Note: Calling this function despite QLowEnergyCharacteristic::properties() reporting a non-writable property always attempts to write to the hardware. Similarly, a WriteWithoutResponse is sent to the hardware too although the characteristic may only support WriteWithResponse. If the hardware returns with an error the CharacteristicWriteError is set.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Llamar a esta función a pesar de que QLowEnergyCharacteristic :: properties () reporta una propiedad que no se puede escribir siempre intenta escribir en el hardware. De manera similar, una WriteWithoutResponse también se envía al hardware, aunque la característica solo puede admitir WriteWithResponse . Si el hardware regresa con un error, se establece CharacteristicWriteError .

trans-unit.source: Note: Calling this function results in changing the cursor position through the windowing system. The windowing system will typically respond by sending mouse events to the application's window. This means that the usage of this function should be avoided in unit tests and everywhere where fake mouse events are being injected via QWindowSystemInterface because the windowing system's mouse state (with regards to buttons for example) may not match the state in the application-generated events.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Al llamar a esta función, se cambia la posición del cursor a través del sistema de ventanas. El sistema de ventanas normalmente responderá enviando eventos del mouse a la ventana de la aplicación. Esto significa que el uso de esta función debe evitarse en las pruebas unitarias y en todos los lugares donde se inyectan eventos de mouse falsos a través de QWindowSystemInterface porque el estado del mouse del sistema de ventanas (con respecto a los botones, por ejemplo) puede no coincidir con el estado de los eventos generados por la aplicación. .

trans-unit.source: Note: Calling this function without previously reserving a thread temporarily increases maxThreadCount(). This is useful when a thread goes to sleep waiting for more work, allowing other threads to continue. Be sure to call reserveThread() when done waiting, so that the thread pool can correctly maintain the activeThreadCount().
trans-unit.target: Nota: Llamar a esta función sin reservar previamente un hilo aumenta temporalmente maxThreadCount (). Esto es útil cuando un hilo se pone en suspensión esperando más trabajo, lo que permite que otros hilos continúen. Asegúrese de llamar a reserveThread () cuando termine de esperar, para que el grupo de subprocesos pueda mantener correctamente el activeThreadCount ().

trans-unit.source: Note: Do not bind to the x, y, width, or height properties of items in a layout, as this would conflict with the goals of Layout, and can also cause binding loops. The width and height properties are used by the layout engine to store the current size of items as calculated from the minimum/preferred/maximum attached properties, and can be ovewritten each time the items are laid out. Use Layout.preferredWidth and Layout.preferredHeight, or implicitWidth and implicitHeight to specify the preferred size of items.
trans-unit.target: Nota: No se vincule a las propiedades x, y, width o height de los elementos de un diseño, ya que esto entraría en conflicto con los objetivos de Layout y también puede provocar bucles de enlace. El motor de diseño utiliza las propiedades de ancho y alto para almacenar el tamaño actual de los elementos calculado a partir de las propiedades adjuntas mínima / preferida / máxima, y se pueden sobrescribir cada vez que se distribuyen los elementos. Utilice Layout.preferredWidth y Layout.preferredHeight , o implicitWidth e implicitHeight para especificar el tamaño preferido de los elementos.

trans-unit.source: Note: Each x-dimension line of the data needs to be 32-bit aligned when targeting the y-axis or z-axis. Los bytes de relleno deben indicar un color completamente transparente para evitar artefactos de reproducción. No se garantiza que QImage lo haga automáticamente.

For instance, under memory pressure, Qt may decide to drop some of the cache information; in such cases an item's paint() function will be called even if there was no update() call (that is, exactly as if there were no caching enabled).
trans-unit.target: Nota: Habilitar el almacenamiento en caché no implica que se llamará a la función paint () del elemento solo en respuesta a una llamada explícita a update (). Por ejemplo, bajo presión de la memoria, Qt puede decidir eliminar parte de la información de la caché; en tales casos , se llamará a la función paint () de un elemento incluso si no hubo una llamada a update () (es decir, exactamente como si no hubiera habilitado el almacenamiento en caché).

trans-unit.source: Note: Enabling caching for an item does not guarantee that paint() will be invoked only once by the Graphics View framework, even without any explicit call to update(). See the documentation of setCacheMode() for more details.

Note: For ISODate formats, each Y, M and D represents a single digit of the year, month and day used to specify the date. Each H, M and S represents a single digit of the hour, minute and second used to specify the time. The presence of a literal T character is used to separate the date and time when both are specified.
trans-unit.target: Nota: Para los formatos ISODate , cada Y , M y D representa un solo dígito del año, mes y día utilizado para especificar la fecha. Cada H , M y S representa un solo dígito de la hora, minuto y segundo utilizados para especificar la hora. La presencia de un carácter T literal se utiliza para separar la fecha y la hora en que se especifican ambos.

trans-unit.source: Note: For ISODate formats, each y, M and d represents a single digit of the year, month, and day used to specify the date. Each H, m, and s represents a single digit of the hour (up to 24), minute and second used to specify the time. An hour of 24, with zero for all other time fields, is understood as the start of the next day. A .zzz stands for a fractional part suffix on the preceding field, which may be separated from that field either by a comma ',' or the dot '.' shown. Precision beyond milliseconds is accepted but discarded, rounding to the nearest representable millisecond. The presence of a literal T character is used to separate the date and time when both are specified. For the TextDate and RFC2822Date formats, ddd stands for the first three letters of the name of the day of the week and MMM stands for the first three letters of the month name. The names of days and months are always in English (C locale) regardless of user preferences or system settings. The other format characters have the same meaning as for the ISODate format, except that 24 is not accepted as an hour. Parts of a format enclosed in square brackets [...] are optional; the square brackets do not form part of the format. The plus-or-minus character '±' here stands for either sign character, '-' for minus or '+' for plus.

Note: For ISODate formats, each y, M and d represents a single digit of the year, month, and day used to specify the date. Each H, m, and s represents a single digit of the hour (up to 24), minute and second used to specify the time. The presence of a literal T character is used to separate the date and time when both are specified. For the RFC2822Date format, MMM stands for the first three letters of the month name in English, the other format characters have the same meaning as for the ISODate format.

trans-unit.target: Nota: Para el requisito de almacenar en caché índices de glifos y selecciones de fuentes para texto estático para evitar la remodelación y el enrutamiento en el bucle interno de una aplicación, una mejor opción es la clase QStaticText , ya que optimiza el costo de memoria del caché y también brinda la posibilidad de cachés específicos del motor de pintura para una aceleración adicional.
